item.description:
Tribal Courts in the Federal System

This event is open to the general public as well as to the HLS community (Public Calendar)

This is apparently a 2-day conference but details are sketchy as of now. If anyone knows more, please let me know. Thanks. Steve

:: :: ::

Thursday, November 8 – Friday, November 9, 2012
Wasserstein Milstein West AB

(times uncertain)

Sponsors: Professor Joseph Singer and Visiting Professor Robert Anderson

Contact E-mail dmuran@law.harvard.edu

Note: The first of its kind at HLS, this conference will bring together tribal judges and attorneys, government policymakers, and scholars to explore issues Indian tribal courts currently face in criminal and civil enforcement, jurisdiction, and lawmaking.

Due to limited space, we may not be able to accommodate everyone who is interested in attending during lunch. Contact Daryl Muranaka at dmuran@law.harvard.edu to reserve a lunch spot.
item.name: Tribal Courts @ Harvard Law
